text: Mineral species are assigned to mineral classes .
Furthermore , minerals within the same class are often found together in the same rock .
Some important mineral classes are the silicates ( SiO442 ) , internal structures and , hence , similar properties .
Mineralogists use the term mineral species for a collection of specimens that exhibit similar internal structures and chemical compositions .
Some mineral species are further subdivided into mineral varieties .
Some common mineral species are quartz , calcite , galena , and pyrite .
However , just as individual plants and animals within a species differ somewhat from one another , so do most specimens of the same mineral .
Minerals are placed into categories in much the same way that plants and animals are classified .
Amethyst , another variety of quartz , owes its violet color to the presence of trace amounts of iron .
However , when small amounts of aluminum are incorporated into its atomic structure , quartz appears quite dark , in a variety called smoky quartz .
For example , pure quartz ( SiO2 ) is colorless and transparent .
